docs.text: " the end of the affair " is a dark and moody romantic period piece , that neil jordan exquisitely writes and directs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it's slow and sometimes confusing to follow , it still manages to give audiences a moving experience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: based on graham greene's novel of the same name , the film mainly follows 3 characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's maurice bendrix ( ralph fiennes ) who has an affair with henry mile's ( stephen rea ) wife sarah ( julianne moore ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sarah finds henry to be a bore , because well , he's just a normal guy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's all work and no play with him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while maurice on the other hand falls madly in love with sarah , and would do anything for her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately the two break up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is all witnessed in a serious of flashbacks , so that leads us to the present .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a few years later , and they both still think of each other , so maurice hires a private detective ( ian hart ) to see what sarah is up too .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while this may sound straight forward it's not .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a deep dark tale of the jealousy that lies in the two men , unhappiness , and the ever lasting love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all this may sound like a drag , but it really captures your interest .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with great performances by ralph fiennes ( doing another english patient type of film , only this movie is better ) and julianna moore who definitely deserves an oscar because out of all 5 films she did in 1999 , i believe this was the role , she had the most passion for , and you can see why .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story was also well written thanks to neil jordan .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even though i didn't read the book , there's no doubt in mind that it was just as moving and descriptive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what's so moving about it you ask ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the tragedy of it all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not the typical romance , in which a guy finds a girl , they fall in love and all is well , this is more complicated and depressing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it really shows the complexity of a relationship , because nothing is ever perfect .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everyone feels a different way and that is what tears us to pieces .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: back to neil jordan's script , it wasn't only red roses .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there were times when i felt it too be a little slow , but most romances are .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it also tended to be a bit confusing , especially at the start .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it keep jumping around from past to present , so it obviously took awhile to get a grasp of things .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also a notable was the superb direction by neil jordan .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'd have to say this is his finest achievement to date , because quite frankly i've never really found his work to be up to par .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it just never did anything for me , until now .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when it ends , it leaves viewers a little saddened , but provoked nonetheless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is definitely one of the best films of 99 , and had some of the best acting , most notably by moore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not for all movie goers , but for those who are film buffs and want something of value .
docs.label: positive
